message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR 

The paper focuses on anomaly detection in surveillance videos using Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) and incorporates optical flow methods for short-term temporal information. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the use of morphological operations for performance improvement indicates that the paper may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper also deals with video material recorded by surveillance cameras, which suggests that it may belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, since the paper deals with anomaly detection in surveillance videos, it may also belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category.
